intro: Thalictrum omeiense, commonly known as the Omei cliffmeadow herb, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and delicate, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
